titleStmt.title: Loves fortune. Or, A faint-hearted souldier will never win the field. The young-mans good fortune in wooing his love: she was rich, and he but poor, and she vowed she ne'r would love him more, yet day and night he took great pain, and for to love her once again. Tune is, Sweet come love me once again.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for F[rancis]. Coles, T[homas]. Vere, J[ohn]. Wright, J[ohn]. Clark, W[illiam]. Thackeray, and T[homas]. Passinger.,

notesStmt.note: Verse: "Walking most early in the morning fair ..."
Date, place of publication and publisher's names from Wing.
Reproduction of original in the Harvard University, Houghton Library.
